title: How to use my computer to make and receive calls from my phone without using the PC suite - Quora

response.answer_text: Try this android app named AirDroid: File Transfer/Manage - Android Apps on Google Play AirDroid allows you to access and manage your Android phone or tablet from Windows, Mac or the Web, wirelessly, for free. I'm sure this app will satisfy all your requirements. When i felt lazy to plug usb or when Android Emulator ran slowly I used AirDroid on my pc for debugging my apps wirelessly. But i later realized, i can do that with adb over wireless network enabled. I still use this app occasionally when i feel lazy to pick up my phone. I guess this works on Non-rooted phones too, but mine is rooted, so i didn’t bother to check it. Guess what, Connect your phone to wifi/internet ,grant access to airdroid, throw your phone anywhere and work with your PC with no worries, the notifications work great for all apps.

There is very simple, you can actually connect a 3G/4G voice call enabled dongle to your pc. Insert any simcard to the donglePulg the dongle to the USBInstall the dongle softwareOpen the dongle softwareClick on number pad on the dongle software (i.e in case of dlink )Dail the number and click CallIf you want to receive calls on the pc then call the number that you have inserted in you dongle. Then definitely you will definitely receive a Voice call on your laptop or desktop.By following these simple steps you can receive and send calls and sms from your PC. IF YOU LIKE, CLICK UPVOTE.
